original: @#/_/rigs byed ma'i sgrub thabs/
analyzed: @#/_/rigs byed ma'i sgrub thabs/

original: @##/_/rgya gar skad du/_ku ru kul+le sa d+ha nam/_bod skad du/
analyzed: @##/_/rgya gar skad du/_ku ru kul+le sa d+ha nam/_bod skad du/
translated: In Sanskrit: Kurukullāsādhana🔽Homage to Kurukullā!🔽From the sequence of the Hevajra Tantra,

original: rigs byed ma'i sgrub thabs/_ku ru kul+le la phyag 'tshhal lo/_/kye yi rdo rje'i
analyzed: rigs byed ma'i sgrub thabs/_ku ru kul+le la phyag 'tshhal lo/_/kye yi rdo rje'i
translated: I bow to the great Kurukullā,

original: rgyud rim las/_/'jig rten gsum po dbang byed pa'i/_/rigs byed chen
analyzed: rgyud rim las/_/'jig rten gsum po dbang byed pa'i/_/rigs byed chen
translated: who rules the three worlds,🔽and clearly explain her sādhana.

original: po la btud nas/_/de yi sgrub thabs gsal bar brjod/_/'dir rgyud las
analyzed: po la btud nas/_/de yi sgrub thabs gsal bar brjod/_/'dir rgyud las
translated: Here, one should meditate on what is taught in the tantra:

analyzed: lhag par bsgom par bya ste/_sngags pas snga bar nyal ba las langs te/_snying
translated: The mantrin, having risen from sleeping early,

analyzed: gar ram yig yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la hrihyig dmar po
translated: should visualize a raṃ syllable at the heart, which becomes a sun mandala with a red hrīḥ syllable🔽upon it.

original: bltas te/_de'i 'od zer gyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bcom ldan 'das ma
analyzed: bltas te/_de'i 'od zer gyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bcom ldan 'das ma
translated: Looking at that, light rays from it invite the Bhagavatī Kurukullā,🔽as will be described, in front.

original: rigs byed ma mdun du bltas nas nyer spyod lnga'i sprin tshhogs kyis yang dag par
analyzed: rigs byed ma mdun du bltas nas nyer spyod lnga'i sprin tshhogs kyis yang dag par
translated: Having made a perfect offering with a mass of clouds of the five offerings,🔽in front of her one should recite:

original: mchod nas/_de'i mdun du/_dkon mchog gsum la bdag skyabs mchi/_/
analyzed: mchod nas/_de'i mdun du/_dkon mchog gsum la bdag skyabs mchi/_/
translated: I go for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshhigs su bcad pa lan gsum du brjod par bya'o/_/de🔽nas sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'i sems can rnams la dmigs te/_de
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshhigs su bcad pa lan gsum du brjod par bya'o/_/de nas sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'i sems can rnams la dmigs te/_de
translated: Recite these verses three times.

original: rnams sdug bsngal ba las 'don pa'i mtshhan nyid kyi snying rje chen po bsgom par🔽bya'o/_/de nas chos dang gang zag gi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin
analyzed: rnams sdug bsngal ba las 'don pa'i mtshhan nyid kyi snying rje chen po bsgom par bya'o/_/de nas chos dang gang zag gi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin
translated: Then, focusing on sentient beings who are suffering, cultivate great compassion, which is characterized by the wish to free them from suffering.

original: dag gi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis su med par brjod pa'i mtshhan nyid kyi
analyzed: dag gi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis su med par brjod pa'i mtshhan nyid kyi
translated: Then, meditate on emptiness, which is characterized by the expression of the nonduality of the nature of the apprehended and apprehender of phenomena and persons, which is the nonexistence of entity.

original: stong pa nyid bsgoms la de'i sngags 7byin gyis brlab par bya'o/_/om shu n+ya ta dz+nya🔽na badzra swa b+ha wa at+ma ko\u0f85ham zhes so/_/de nas de rnams lha dang nam mkha'
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgoms la de'i sngags 7byin gyis brlab par bya'o/_/om shu n+ya ta dz+nya na badzra swa b+ha wa at+ma ko\u0f85ham zhes so/_/de nas de rnams lha dang nam mkha'
translated: Bless it with the mantra: Oṃ śūnyatā jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.🔽Then, think that the deity and space are nondual.

original: gnyis su med par bsam par bya'o_/_/nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bltas la/
analyzed: gnyis su med par bsam par bya'o_/_/nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bltas la/
translated: Looking at the maṇḍala of the sun,

analyzed: de'i dbus su hrih_dmar po yongs su gyur pa las ut+pa la dmar po'i ze'u 'bru

original: la nyi ma la lha'i sa bon no/_/de la spro ba dang bsdu ba byas nas de la de bzhin
analyzed: la nyi ma la lha'i sa bon no/_/de la spro ba dang bsdu ba byas nas de la de bzhin
translated: In the center of that is a sun, and on that is the seed syllable of the deity.🔽Having emanated and reabsorbed light from that, imagine that the entire

original: du rab tu zhugs nas de thams cad yongs su gyur pa las dpal ku ru kul+le'i skur
analyzed: du rab tu zhugs nas de thams cad yongs su gyur pa las dpal ku ru kul+le'i skur
translated: world and its beings transform into the form of glorious Kurukullā.

original: bdag nyid blta bar bya'o/_/chu skyes dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa'i dbus su
analyzed: bdag nyid blta bar bya'o/_/chu skyes dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa'i dbus su
translated: In the center of a red lotus with eight petals,🔽on a sun seat in the heart of a corpse, she stands in the dancing pose of

analyzed: ro'i snying gar nyi ma'i steng du dkyil 'khor phyed pa'i gar stabs kyis bzhugs pa/_nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od la phyogs dang phyogs mtshhams brgyad du
translated: half-khaṭvāṅga.🔽She is surrounded by the eight charnel grounds in the eight directions,🔽which are defined by the light of the sun mandala.

original: dur khrod brgyad kyis yongs su bskor ba/_sku mdog dmar mo lo brgyad gnyis
analyzed: dur khrod brgyad kyis yongs su bskor ba/_sku mdog dmar mo lo brgyad gnyis
translated: She is red, with a body like that of an eighteen-year-old.

original: lon pa lta bu/_dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa/_dbu la sangs rgyas
analyzed: lon pa lta bu/_dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa/_dbu la sangs rgyas
translated: Her orange hair swirls upward.

analyzed: lnga'i rang bzhin thod pa lngas brgyan pa/_mgo bo rlon pa'i do shal gyis brgyan pa/

original: zhal mche ba gtshigs pa/_ljags 'dril ba/_spyan gsum dmar zhing zlum pa
analyzed: zhal mche ba gtshigs pa/_ljags 'dril ba/_spyan gsum dmar zhing zlum pa
translated: Her fangs are bared, her tongue is rolled, and her three eyes are red and🔽round.

analyzed: g.yon du lta ba/_khro zhing sgeg pa'i nyams can/_rus pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'khol lo dang /_rna rgyan dang /_mgul rgyan dang /_lag gdub dang /_ska
translated: She is looking to the left, with a wrathful and passionate expression, and is adorned with🔽the five symbolic bone ornaments—a head ornament, earrings, a long necklace,

analyzed: rags dang /_dpung rgyan dang /_rkang gdub rnams kyis brgyan pa/_rtsha
translated: bracelets, and anklets—and with a belt, armlets, and a choker.🔽Her two

analyzed: ba'i phyag gnyis kyis me tog dmar po'i gzhu dang ut+pa la'i mde'u can gyi mda'

analyzed: rna ba'i rtshar 'gengs pa/_phyag lhag ma gnyis kyis ut+pa la'i zhags pa dang /

analyzed: rigs byed ma'i sgrub thabs/ lcags kyu bsnams pa bsam par bya'o/_/de'i spyi bo dang mgrin pa dang snying ga
translated: Sādhana of Ratidevī🔽One should visualize at her forehead, throat, and heart

analyzed: rnams su om \u0f10zhes pa'i yi ge rnams blta bar bya'o/_/de nas rang gi snying

analyzed: gar nyi ma la gnas pa'i ut+pa la dmar po'i ze'u 'bru la nyi ma la hrih_yig dmar
translated: red utpala flower, is a red hrīḥ syllable on a sun [disc].🔽Light rays from that

analyzed: po bltas la/_de'i 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bskul zhing
translated: invoke all tathāgatas, who then enter [the hrīḥ syllable].

analyzed: gdan drangs nas dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab par bya ste/_bdud rtshi
translated: Having invited them, one should request the empowerment:

analyzed: lngas gang ba'i bum pa rnams kyis dbang bskur zhing bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag
translated: The five elixirs fill the vase, and one is empowered. Bhagavat Amitābha crowns one’s head.

analyzed: med kyis dbu brgyan pa'o/_/de nas rang gi snying gar sa bon brgyad las lha mo
translated: Then, the eight seed syllables arise in one’s heart as goddesses,

analyzed: byung ste/_rang rang gi byang chub kyi sems kyi khu bas yang dag par mchod nas
translated: who offer the nectar of their bodhicitta to the deities.🔽The seed syllables are emanated from them in the same way.🔽The praise:

analyzed: de la de bzhin du sa bon_spro bar bya'o/_/sngags dang yi ge rnam par spangs/_/
translated: Free of mantra and syllables,🔽not a drop, not the mind,

analyzed: thig le ma yin sems ma yin/_/'di ni mchog gi bde chen te/_/dor ba

analyzed: med cing blang du med/_/ces pa 'dis bstod nas/_de nas bdud rtshi myang
translated: not to be discarded, not to be taken.

original: ba'i cho gas bdud rtshi rnam pa lnga rab tu 'bar zhing rdzogs pas hum yig dkar po
analyzed: ba'i cho gas bdud rtshi rnam pa lnga rab tu 'bar zhing rdzogs pas hum yig dkar po
translated: Then, the five-branch elixirs are tasted. The five elixirs are completely blazing.🔽From the white syllable hūṃ, the tongue is made vajra nature.

original: las lce rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byas la yi ge gsum gyis brlabs nas bdag nyid
analyzed: las lce rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byas la yi ge gsum gyis brlabs nas bdag nyid
translated: Having consecrated with the three syllables, one should taste the elixir.

original: ku ru kul+le'i skur bsgom mo/_/bsgoms pas skyo na sngags pas sngags bzlas
analyzed: ku ru kul+le'i skur bsgom mo/_/bsgoms pas skyo na sngags pas sngags bzlas
translated: If one becomes weary of meditating in this way, the mantrin should recite the mantra.

original: par bya'o/_/de bzhin du d+hih_yig la yang dag par bskor zhing gnas pa'o/_/
analyzed: par bya'o/_/de bzhin du d+hih_yig la yang dag par bskor zhing gnas pa'o/_/
translated: In the same way, the syllable dhih is completely surrounded and abides.🔽The mantra of the eight syllables, “Oṃ kuru ku llé hrih svāhā,” is the garland of

original: om ku ru kul+le hrih_swa ha/_zhes pa'i yi ge brgyad po'i sngags ni sngags kyi phreng🔽ba 'bar ba bzhin du yid kyis bskor nas/_myur ba dang bul ba la sogs
analyzed: om ku ru kul+le hrih_swa ha/_zhes pa'i yi ge brgyad po'i sngags ni sngags kyi phreng ba 'bar ba bzhin du yid kyis bskor nas/_myur ba dang bul ba la sogs
translated: mantras.🔽Mentally turning it like a blazing fire, free from the faults of being too🔽fast or too slow, one should recite it with a garland of red sandalwood

analyzed: pa'i skyon rnams dang bral zhing tshan+dan dmar po'i phreng bas bzlas par bya'o/_/
translated: rosaries.

original: bye ba drug bzlas na 'gro ba drug la 'khor los sgyur zhing sems can rnams🔽dbang du byed do/_/thun mtshhams kyi nang du skad cig gis bdag nyid ku ru
analyzed: bye ba drug bzlas na 'gro ba drug la 'khor los sgyur zhing sems can rnams dbang du byed do/_/thun mtshhams kyi nang du skad cig gis bdag nyid ku ru
translated: If one recites it six million times, one will turn the wheel for the six🔽classes of migrating beings and bring sentient beings under one’s power.🔽In between sessions, one should imagine that one instantly generates🔽oneself in the form of Kurukullā and perform the offerings, praises, and

original: kul+le'i skur bskyed par bsams nas mchod pa dang bstod pa la sogs pa bya'o/_/
analyzed: kul+le'i skur bskyed par bsams nas mchod pa dang bstod pa la sogs pa bya'o/_/
translated: so forth.🔽All activities, such as listening and explaining, should be performed

original: nyan bshad la sogs pa bya ba thams cad bcom ldan 'das ma'i nga rgyal gyis de
analyzed: nyan bshad la sogs pa bya ba thams cad bcom ldan 'das ma'i nga rgyal gyis de
translated: with the pride of being the Bhagavatī.

original: bzhin du bya'o/_/de nas smon lam gdab pa la sogs pa byas nas ci bder nyal
analyzed: bzhin du bya'o/_/de nas smon lam gdab pa la sogs pa byas nas ci bder nyal
translated: Then, having made prayers of aspiration and so forth, sleep as you please.

original: bar bya'o/_/man ngag 'di yang bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas shes shing rang gi
analyzed: bar bya'o/_/man ngag 'di yang bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas shes shing rang gi
translated: This instruction should be understood through the stages of the lineage of gurus.

original: snying ga'i sa bon las bdud rtshi'i khu ba 'dzag bzhin pa snying ga las langs nas🔽mgo bo nas g.yon du 'khor zhing dkris nas rna ba g.yas kyi bu gar zhugs
analyzed: snying ga'i sa bon las bdud rtshi'i khu ba 'dzag bzhin pa snying ga las langs nas mgo bo nas g.yon du 'khor zhing dkris nas rna ba g.yas kyi bu gar zhugs
translated: The essence of the elixir falls from the seed syllable in your heart, and it rises up from your heart.🔽It circles to the left and wraps around your head, and it enters through the right ear.

original: shing lag pa g.yas pas gzhu'i rgyud la gnas pa'i/_mda'i ltang gi bu ga nas
analyzed: shing lag pa g.yas pas gzhu'i rgyud la gnas pa'i/_mda'i ltang gi bu ga nas
translated: It enters the hollow of the arrowhead that is on the bowstring held by your right hand.

original: mde'u'i rtshe mor zhugs shing de'i 'od zer 'phro zhing gsal bas srid pa gsum
analyzed: mde'u'i rtshe mor zhugs shing de'i 'od zer 'phro zhing gsal bas srid pa gsum
translated: Its light radiates and illuminates the three existences.

original: du song nas sems can rnams kyi snying la zhugs te/_de'i steng du chu skyes
analyzed: du song nas sems can rnams kyi snying la zhugs te/_de'i steng du chu skyes
translated: Having gone there, it enters the hearts of sentient beings.🔽Having fully activated the lotuses above that, it draws them in.

original: rnams yang dag par bskul nas bkug ste/_slar yang de la de bzhin du zhugs
analyzed: rnams yang dag par bskul nas bkug ste/_slar yang de la de bzhin du zhugs
translated: Again, it enters there in the same way.

original: nas mda'i mde'u las rna ba'i bu ga nas mgo la g.yas su bskor bas smin ma'i
analyzed: nas mda'i mde'u las rna ba'i bu ga nas mgo la g.yas su bskor bas smin ma'i
translated: From the arrowhead, it enters through the earhole and circles to the right on your head.

original: dbus su gnas nas a ba d+hu ti'i lam nas mgrin pa dang snying ga dang lte ba'i
analyzed: dbus su gnas nas a ba d+hu ti'i lam nas mgrin pa dang snying ga dang lte ba'i
translated: Having entered the central channel, he should be caused to enter the

original: mthar thug pa bde ba chen po'i snang ba'i gnas la man ngag ji lta ba bzhin du
analyzed: mthar thug pa bde ba chen po'i snang ba'i gnas la man ngag ji lta ba bzhin du
translated: places of the appearances of great bliss, the throat, the heart, and the navel,

original: rab tu gzhug par bya'o/_/de nas thabs dang shes rab dri ma med pa'i ting nge
analyzed: rab tu gzhug par bya'o/_/de nas thabs dang shes rab dri ma med pa'i ting nge
translated: according to the instructions. Then, his body and the three realms should

original: 'dzin las yang dag par byung ba de'i bde ba chen pos gang ba bzhin du rang gi🔽lus dang khams gsum yang blta bar bya'o/_/de'i skad cig la tshhigs su bcad
analyzed: 'dzin las yang dag par byung ba de'i bde ba chen pos gang ba bzhin du rang gi lus dang khams gsum yang blta bar bya'o/_/de'i skad cig la tshhigs su bcad
translated: be seen as filled with the great bliss that arises from the samādhi of pure🔽method and wisdom. At that moment, one should recall this verse:

original: pa 'di'i 7don dran par bya ste/_thog ma dbus mtha' med pa ste/_/'khor ba
analyzed: pa 'di'i 7don dran par bya ste/_thog ma dbus mtha' med pa ste/_/'khor ba
translated: Without beginning, middle, or end,🔽neither saṃsāra nor nirvāṇa,🔽it is great bliss,

original: dang ni myang 'das min/_/de ni bde ba chen po ste/_/bdag min gzhan yang
analyzed: dang ni myang 'das min/_/de ni bde ba chen po ste/_/bdag min gzhan yang
translated: neither self nor other.

original: min pa'o/_/de bzhin du slar yang ji snyed pa'i sems can rnams dbang du byas
analyzed: min pa'o/_/de bzhin du slar yang ji snyed pa'i sems can rnams dbang du byas
translated: In the same way, having brought under control all sentient beings,

original: nas de la byang chub chen po mngon sum du byas te/_de bzhin du sbyor bas bzod
analyzed: nas de la byang chub chen po mngon sum du byas te/_de bzhin du sbyor bas bzod
translated: one should actualize great awakening.

analyzed: par bya'o/_/de bzhin du bsgrub 7bya dang bsgrub bya mo ku ru kul+le'i skur
translated: In the same way, having meditated on the object of attainment and the means of attainment in the form of Kurukullā,

original: bsgoms nas gang du de'i sa bon la de bzhin du sgrub pa po'i mda' las bsgrub🔽rigs byed ma'i sgrub thabs
analyzed: bsgoms nas gang du de'i sa bon la de bzhin du sgrub pa po'i mda' las bsgrub rigs byed ma'i sgrub thabs
translated: the practitioner should shoot an arrow at the object of attainment,

analyzed: bya'i lag na gnas pa'i mda'i la de'i 'od zer gyi rnam par song nas/
translated: and it will go forth in the form of light rays from the arrow in the hand of the bird.🔽In the same way, it enters the right ear of the object of attainment,

analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba g.yas nas zhugs te de bzhin du song zhing de bzhin du gnas
translated: and in the same way, it goes forth and in the same way, it abides.

original: nas de bzhin du zhugs shing de'i gnas la son nas de bzhin du gnas par bya'o//
analyzed: nas de bzhin du zhugs shing de'i gnas la son nas de bzhin du gnas par bya'o//
translated: In the same way, it enters and reaches the place of the object of attainment and in the same way, it abides.

original: dpal ku ru kul+le'i rtog pa las d+hih_yig myos byed kyi gdug la dgod par
analyzed: dpal ku ru kul+le'i rtog pa las d+hih_yig myos byed kyi gdug la dgod par
translated: The Kurukullākalpa teaches the placement of the syllable dhih in the intoxicating drink:

analyzed: gsungs te/_de nas nges par bsgrub bya sgrub pa po'i gzhan dbang du gyur
translated: “Then, the object of attainment, having become subject to the practitioner,

original: nas yid spro bas 7bya ba thams cad byed par 'gyur ro/_/ku ru kul+le'i sgrub
analyzed: nas yid spro bas 7bya ba thams cad byed par 'gyur ro/_/ku ru kul+le'i sgrub
translated: will do everything with a delighted mind.”🔽I have explained the means of achieving Kurukullā.

original: thabs bshad/_/cho ga 'di bsgrubs bsod nams gang /_/_de yis skye bo ma
analyzed: thabs bshad/_/cho ga 'di bsgrubs bsod nams gang /_/_de yis skye bo ma
translated: Whatever merit I have gained

original: lus kun/_/dbang gyur byang chub sbyor bar shog_/dpal kye'i rdo rje'i
analyzed: lus kun/_/dbang gyur byang chub sbyor bar shog_/dpal kye'i rdo rje'i
translated: May all my limbs be fit for the practice of enlightenment.

original: rgyud las rang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o/_/rigs byed ma'i sgrub thabs
